history.content: IMO I personally think that taking 55 before 70 is a waste of time. If you are worried about the material you might as well review 70 notes from previous semesters.

children.subject: I also want to mention that if you're thinking of next semester, Holtz's Math 55 is quite difficult (very fun, but actually REALLY difficult).  Maybe that doesn't matter if you're P/NPing.  But my instinct would be that 70 will be a lower workload than 55 next semester.  Then again, it might be really really solid preparation!  I just don't know if it's the kind you'd want.
If you are afraid of taking 70 rn, just audit it and take it the following semester

If you take Math 55 P/NP and you pass it, you wont be able to receive credit for CS 70. Also, even if you took Math 55 with a grade and you pass the class, the course can't waive the CS 70 requirement unless you are a math/cs double major. I'm not sure if they ever make exceptions, but you should talk to an advisor before taking Math 55, otherwise, you may have issues declaring the major later if you can't take CS 70 for credit.

To premise, I have taken both Math 55 and CS70. 

There is an incredible amount of overlap between CS70 and Math55. CS70 has a stronger focus on probability and will go into further depth, whereas you'll only get the basics of probability from Math55. Save for 1 or 2 topics (some in 55 that aren't in 70 and vice versa) there is next to no difference in the Discrete Math portion of the class. 

If I had taken Math 55 before CS70, I would have had a much easier time than I ended up having. However, if the point is to prepare for CS70, then you might as well 'take' CS70 instead of Math55. And so, I will echo the other responses and say that auditing CS70 or heavily reviewing it's notes and problems from previous semesters would have the same effect.

history.content: Hello, if I'm an intended CS major, would you recommend P/NP Math 55 before taking CS 70 if I'm worried about the GPA cutoff.
history.subject: Taking Math 55 before CS70
